001package io.jstach.rainbowgum.spring.boot.spi;
002
003import java.util.Optional;
004
005import org.springframework.core.env.Environment;
006
007import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig;
008import io.jstach.rainbowgum.RainbowGum;
009import io.jstach.rainbowgum.spi.RainbowGumServiceProvider;
010import io.jstach.rainbowgum.spi.RainbowGumServiceProvider.RainbowGumProvider;
011
012/**
013 * Provides a custom Spring Boot aware RainbowGum through
014 * <code>META-INF/spring.factories</code>. The reason this SPI exists is if one wants to
015 * create a custom Rainbow Gum that has spring configuration available. Besides providing
016 * Spring environment the other reason the {@link RainbowGumServiceProvider} is not used
017 * is because this module has a registration of {@link RainbowGumProvider} that is used
018 * for Spring Boot initialization (the events are queued) that is then replaced with the
019 * Spring Boot configuration powered RainbowGum.
020 */
021public interface SpringRainbowGumServiceProvider {
022
023        /**
024         * Provides a Rainbow Gum that has configuration already Spring Bootified.
025         * @param config config that is setup to use Spring Boot environment.
026         * @param classLoader class loader used by Spring Boot.
027         * @param environment Spring environment.
028         * @return optional provides.
029         */
030        public Optional<RainbowGum> provide(LogConfig config, ClassLoader classLoader,
031                        @SuppressWarnings("exports") Environment environment);
032
033}
